chapter.title: Overview of Librsvg's API
chapter.para: Librsvg's API is divided into two main parts: one for loading SVG data and one for rendering it. In the loading stage, you create an RsvgHandle object from SVG data, which can come from a file or from a stream of bytes. In the rendering stage, you take an RsvgHandle and ask it to render itself to a Cairo context.

formalpara.title: Loading
formalpara.para: RsvgHandle is an object that represents SVG data in memory. Your program creates an RsvgHandle from an SVG file, or from a memory buffer that contains SVG data, or in the most general form, from a GIO stream that will provide SVG data. At this stage you can get either I/O errors or parsing errors. If loading completes successfully, the RsvgHandle will be ready for rendering.

formalpara.title: Rendering
formalpara.para: Once you have a loaded RsvgHandle, you can render it to a Cairo context any number of times, or to different Cairo contexts, as needed.
